introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• Malala Yousafzai began advocating for girls’ education at an early age.
• In 2012, she survived an attack by those opposed to her activism.
• She co-founded the Malala Fund to champion every girl’s right to 12 years of free, safe, quality education.
• In 2014, she received the Nobel Peace Prize, becoming its youngest-ever laureate.
• She has authored a memoir detailing her experiences and vision.
question: The student wants to stress Malala Yousafzai’s global advocacy and its significance. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Malala Yousafzai is the youngest person ever to receive the Nobel Peace Prize, an honor she won in 2014.
B: Malala co-founded the Malala Fund, which supports access to 12 years of safe, quality education for girls worldwide.
C: By advocating for girls’ education and founding the Malala Fund, Malala Yousafzai became a globally recognized champion of educational rights, earning the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014.
D: Malala Yousafzai wrote about her experiences and nearly lost her life in 2012.
explanation: Choice C highlights both her key advocacy efforts (the Malala Fund) and her Nobel Peace Prize achievement, underscoring her global significance.
